outcome.goal_text: Evaluate Pokemon TCG gameplay quality and strategic play at the end of the rollout

criteria.description: Did the agent win? If not, did it create a clear advantage (e.g., prize lead, board control) by the end of the rollout?
Demonstrates a coherent prize plan and tempo: prioritizes taking prizes, avoids low-impact lines when meaningful progress (damage/prizes/board improvement) is available.
Manages resources well: attaches energy with intent, avoids wasting limited resources, and makes reasonable retreat/switch choices relative to board state.
Develops the board: benches basics when appropriate, evolves when possible, and maintains an attacker pipeline rather than stalling with an empty/fragile board.
Avoid obvious blunders and self-sabotage (illegal actions, wasting turns, repeatedly missing attacks when available).

events.goal_text: Evaluate action quality during the rollout (basic best practices)

criteria.description: Actions are legal and follow the current available_actions requirements.
Attaches energy most turns when it enables near-term attacks or improves future tempo; avoids obviously wasted attachments.
Evolves Pokémon when it improves survivability/damage output and is available.
Makes progress (attach energy, evolve, attack) and avoids stalling.
Attacks when a reasonable attack is available instead of passing unnecessarily.
Selects reasonable targets: prefers taking prizes or threatening KOs over low-value attacks when choices exist.
